page.title: 09Kelso and District Media
page.content: The{local media}consists of two newspapers - the{Southern Reporter and the{Kelso Echo}- and a radio station,{Radio Tweed.}This broadcasts twice daily from Selkirk:{07.30-08.00 and{17.30-18.00.}It began in 1983 and its programmes reach all the Borders. Its estimated audience is{4000-5000}in the morning and{3000}in the evening. The oldest and largest paper is the {Southern Reporter.}Its offices are in Kelso but it is printed in Selkirk and comes out on Thursdays.{16000 copies are printed and recently the property rates increase has been given most coverage. Also, people buy it for the sports news, the announcements and adverts. The{Kelso Echo}is a small paper owned and written by a local man with one helper. It comes out on a Friday and was established in 1983. Both papers use hot metal setting.
